content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    code_blocks = split(md, "\n\n")
    julia_code = String[]
    
    for block in code_blocks
        if occursin("```julia", block) || occursin("```jl", block)
            julia_block = replace(block, r"```(julia|jl)\n?" => "")
            push!(julia_code, julia_block)
        end
    end
    
    return join(julia_code, "\n\n")
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown document `md` as input. It splits the markdown into separate blocks and iterates through them to identify Julia code blocks.

If a block starts with "```julia" or "```jl", it is considered a Julia code block. The function removes the code fence and adds the cleaned-up block to an array of Julia code.

Finally, all the collected Julia code blocks are joined together with two newline characters between each block. This concatenated string is then returned by the function.
